item.title: Broad Institute Wins Big Battle Over CRISPR Gene-Editing Patent
item.description: February 15, 2017 - CRISPR technology is already worth billions of dollars, investors say. This ruling seems to affirm the biggest piece of the pie goes to the Broad, over patent rival University of California, Berkeley.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - CRISPR technology is already worth billions of dollars, investors say. This ruling seems to affirm the biggest piece of the pie goes to the Broad, over patent rival University of California, Berkeley. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/15/515459773/broad-institute-wins-big-battle-over-crispr-gene-editing-patent

item.title: For Food Manufacturers, 'Sell By' Labels May Have Reached Their Expiration Date
item.description: February 15, 2017 - Those "expiration" labels on packaged food may confuse consumers and dupe them into throwing good food in the trash. Two major food industry associations want to change that and are proposing reforms.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - Those "expiration" labels on packaged food may confuse consumers and dupe them into throwing good food in the trash. Two major food industry associations want to change that and are proposing reforms. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/02/15/515427797/food-companies-may-say-goodbye-to-sell-by-labels

item.title: Scientists May Have Solved The Mystery Of Nodding Syndrome
item.description: February 15, 2017 - For decades, scientists suspected that the parasite responsible for river blindness might be causing a rare form of epilepsy. Now they have evidence.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - For decades, scientists suspected that the parasite responsible for river blindness might be causing a rare form of epilepsy. Now they have evidence. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/15/515424720/scientists-may-have-solved-the-mystery-of-nodding-syndrome

item.title: Shorter Enrollment Period For Obamacare Proposed By Administration
item.description: February 15, 2017 - The White House is proposing changes to the Affordable Care Act to stabilize the insurance market as Congress moves to repeal and replace the sweeping health care law.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - The White House is proposing changes to the Affordable Care Act to stabilize the insurance market as Congress moves to repeal and replace the sweeping health care law. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/15/515440836/shorter-enrollment-period-for-obamacare-proposed-by-administration

item.title: Another Big Health Insurer Loosens Rules For Covering Addiction Treatment
item.description: February 15, 2017 - Doctors treating people addicted to opioids often need approval from insurers before giving drugs that ease withdrawal. The delay can be risky for patients. Insurers are starting to come around.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - Doctors treating people addicted to opioids often need approval from insurers before giving drugs that ease withdrawal. The delay can be risky for patients. Insurers are starting to come around. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/15/515239382/another-big-health-insurer-loosens-rules-for-covering-addiction-treatment

item.title: Feeling Way More Stressed Out? You're Not Alone
item.description: February 15, 2017 - A January poll finds that people's stress levels have spiked since August, with two-thirds of people saying they're worried about the future of the nation.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - A January poll finds that people's stress levels have spiked since August, with two-thirds of people saying they're worried about the future of the nation. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/15/515366975/feeling-way-more-stressed-out-youre-not-alone

item.title: India's Largest Dairy Brand Prepares To Market An Acquired Taste: Camel Milk
item.description: February 15, 2017 - A nomadic community of camel herders in India has long relied on camel milk as their source of dairy. Now, a big Indian company is getting ready to mass market camel milk as a health food.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - A nomadic community of camel herders in India has long relied on camel milk as their source of dairy. Now, a big Indian company is getting ready to mass market camel milk as a health food. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/02/15/514544612/once-restricted-to-herders-camel-milk-is-about-to-hit-the-shelves-across-india

item.title: The Perplexing Psychology Of Saving For Health Care
item.description: February 15, 2017 - Even many people eligible for a health savings account who have extra cash to contribute to one don't do it. Therapists say that's partly because nobody wants to admit they will get old or sick.
item.itunes:summary: February 15, 2017 - Even many people eligible for a health savings account who have extra cash to contribute to one don't do it. Therapists say that's partly because nobody wants to admit they will get old or sick. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/15/515038556/the-perplexing-psychology-of-saving-for-health-care

item.title: Congress Moves To Overturn D.C. 'Death With Dignity Law'
item.description: February 14, 2017 - The D.C. law gives District physicians the right to prescribe lethal medication to terminally ill patients who have less than six months to live.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - The D.C. law gives District physicians the right to prescribe lethal medication to terminally ill patients who have less than six months to live. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/14/515228620/congress-moves-to-overturn-d-c-death-with-dignity-law

item.title: Duchenne Drug Delayed After Outrage Over Price
item.description: February 14, 2017 - Many Duchenne muscular dystrophy patients in the U.S. have imported a medicine called deflazacort for about $1,200 a year. A brand-name version just approved for sale in America costs $89,000.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - Many Duchenne muscular dystrophy patients in the U.S. have imported a medicine called deflazacort for about $1,200 a year. A brand-name version just approved for sale in America costs $89,000. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/14/515046376/duchenne-drug-delayed-after-outrage-over-price

item.title: What Do You Want To Know About Pandemics? Submit A Question
item.description: February 14, 2017 - We're running a series on the rise of killer viruses. If there's something you'd like to know, ask us. We'll answer reader queries in an upcoming story.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - We're running a series on the rise of killer viruses. If there's something you'd like to know, ask us. We'll answer reader queries in an upcoming story. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/14/514508101/what-do-you-want-to-know-about-pandemics-submit-a-question

item.title: Scientific Panel Says Editing Heritable Human Genes Could Be OK In The Future
item.description: February 14, 2017 - The National Academy of Medicine and National Academy of Sciences say a long-standing taboo on editing human genes could be lifted — even if the changes can be carried through to future generations.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - The National Academy of Medicine and National Academy of Sciences say a long-standing taboo on editing human genes could be lifted — even if the changes can be carried through to future generations. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/14/514580162/scientific-panel-says-editing-heritable-human-genes-could-be-ok-in-the-future

item.title: Aetna And Humana Call Off Merger After Court Decision
item.description: February 14, 2017 - The two healthcare giants said they were no longer pursuing the deal. A federal judge blocked the merger in January, citing its likely adverse effect on competition in the health insurance market.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - The two healthcare giants said they were no longer pursuing the deal. A federal judge blocked the merger in January, citing its likely adverse effect on competition in the health insurance market. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/14/515167491/aetna-and-humana-call-off-merger-after-court-decision

item.title: Cooling Cap May Limit Chemo Hair Loss In Women With Breast Cancer
item.description: February 14, 2017 - Cooling caps haven't been studied much in the U.S., and only one is approved by the FDA. Studies of two different caps show they can reduce hair loss by half in many women undergoing chemo.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - Cooling caps haven't been studied much in the U.S., and only one is approved by the FDA. Studies of two different caps show they can reduce hair loss by half in many women undergoing chemo. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/14/515164003/cooling-cap-may-limit-chemo-hair-loss-in-women-with-breast-cancer

item.title: From Vector To Zoonotic: A Glossary For Infectious Diseases
item.description: February 14, 2017 - The world of infectious diseases has more than a few words and phrases you might want to know more about. We've got definitions for 11 key terms.
item.itunes:summary: February 14, 2017 - The world of infectious diseases has more than a few words and phrases you might want to know more about. We've got definitions for 11 key terms. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/14/512875686/from-vector-to-zoonotic-a-glossary-for-infectious-diseases
